title: Chinese Government dispatches 10th Chinese Medical Team to Port Vila Central Hospital
description: On March 30th, 2015, a welcome ceremony was held for the arrival of the 10th Chinese Medical team to Port Vila Central Hospital (or 援瓦维拉港第十期医疗队). The ceremony was attended by the Chinese Ambassador, Xie Bohua, and the Vanuatu Minister of Health, Willie Reuben Abel. The team was based at the Port Vila Central Hospital and, according to "THE 10th CHINESE MEDICAL TEAM ARRIVED IN PORT VILA," the medical team included "General Surgery, Mr. Wang Dianjun, General Physician, Ms. Li Ping, Obstetrics & Gynecology, Ms. Yang Li, and Interpreter, Mr. Shen Jiwei." The team left Vanuatu after a farewell ceremony on September 16th, 2016 ("驻瓦努阿图大使刘全出席援瓦维拉港第十期医疗队欢送仪式"). Chinese medical teams have been sent to Port Vila Central Hospital since 1993 and include 7-9 doctors.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 10th Chinese Medical Team to Port Vila Central Hospital

# Description
On March 30th, 2015, a welcome ceremony was held for the arrival of the 10th Chinese Medical team to Port Vila Central Hospital (or 援瓦维拉港第十期医疗队). The ceremony was attended by the Chinese Ambassador, Xie Bohua, and the Vanuatu Minister of Health, Willie Reuben Abel. The team was based at the Port Vila Central Hospital and, according to "THE 10th CHINESE MEDICAL TEAM ARRIVED IN PORT VILA," the medical team included "General Surgery, Mr. Wang Dianjun, General Physician, Ms. Li Ping, Obstetrics & Gynecology, Ms. Yang Li, and Interpreter, Mr. Shen Jiwei." The team left Vanuatu after a farewell ceremony on September 16th, 2016 ("驻瓦努阿图大使刘全出席援瓦维拉港第十期医疗队欢送仪式"). Chinese medical teams have been sent to Port Vila Central Hospital since 1993 and include 7-9 doctors.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare provision without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment to hospital, healthcare focus, no energy-related components

title: Chinese Government dispatches 11th Chinese Medical Team to Port Vila Central Hospital
description: On October 30th, 2015, the Chinese Ambassador, Xie Bohua, and the Vanuatu Prime Minister signed letters of exchange for the 11th Chinese Medical Team (or 援瓦维拉港第十一期医疗队). On February 8th, 2017, a welcome ceremony was held for the medical team ('驻瓦努阿图大使刘全出席援瓦维拉港第十一期医疗队欢迎仪式"). The team will include 7-9 doctors and be based at the Port Vila Central Hospital, where China has been sending medical teams since 1993.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 11th Chinese Medical Team to Port Vila Central Hospital

# Description
On October 30th, 2015, the Chinese Ambassador, Xie Bohua, and the Vanuatu Prime Minister signed letters of exchange for the 11th Chinese Medical Team (or 援瓦维拉港第十一期医疗队). On February 8th, 2017, a welcome ceremony was held for the medical team ('驻瓦努阿图大使刘全出席援瓦维拉港第十一期医疗队欢迎仪式"). The team will include 7-9 doctors and be based at the Port Vila Central Hospital, where China has been sending medical teams since 1993.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Dispatch of medical team to hospital, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Government dispatches 17th Chinese Medical Team to Northern District Hospital
description: On October 30th, 2015, the Chinese Ambassador, Xie Bohua, and Vanuatu's Prime Minister signed letters of exchange for the provision of the 17th medical team in a medical technology cooperation project to Santo Northern Hospital. China has been sending medical teams to the Santo Northern Hospital since 1985. These teams typically include 7-9 doctors and serve for 2 years. The project has been implemented ("驻瓦努阿图大使刘全赴桑托岛考察").
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 17th Chinese Medical Team to Northern District Hospital

# Description
On October 30th, 2015, the Chinese Ambassador, Xie Bohua, and Vanuatu's Prime Minister signed letters of exchange for the provision of the 17th medical team in a medical technology cooperation project to Santo Northern Hospital. China has been sending medical teams to the Santo Northern Hospital since 1985. These teams typically include 7-9 doctors and serve for 2 years. The project has been implemented ("驻瓦努阿图大使刘全赴桑托岛考察").
justification: Project is focused on healthcare provision with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team deployment, healthcare focus, no energy or infrastructure components mentioned

title: Chinese government grants emergency relief supplies through Embassy to Vanuatu after Cyclone Pam
description: On March 17th, 2015, the Chinese government granted their first relief package through the Chinese Embassy following Cyclone Pam, which hit Vanuatu on March 13th and 14th (or 向瓦政府捐赠首批紧急救灾物资). The relief package included "4,250 kg of rice, 115 boxes of bottled water, 204 boxes of canned fish, 224 boxes of instant noodle, 4500 pieces of clothes and shoes" ("The Friendship of China and Vanuatu, Not Weakened but Consolidated by Cyclone Pam").
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese government grants emergency relief supplies through Embassy to Vanuatu after Cyclone Pam

# Description
On March 17th, 2015, the Chinese government granted their first relief package through the Chinese Embassy following Cyclone Pam, which hit Vanuatu on March 13th and 14th (or 向瓦政府捐赠首批紧急救灾物资). The relief package included "4,250 kg of rice, 115 boxes of bottled water, 204 boxes of canned fish, 224 boxes of instant noodle, 4500 pieces of clothes and shoes" ("The Friendship of China and Vanuatu, Not Weakened but Consolidated by Cyclone Pam").
justification: Project involves humanitarian aid and emergency relief supplies without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Emergency relief supplies including food, water, and clothing provided after natural disaster

title: Chinese Government grant for the first batch of Cyclone Pam emergency relief supplies (linked to project #49212)
description: On March 22nd, 2015, the first batch of emergency relief from the Chinese Ministry of Commerce arrived. It arrived by chartered plane at the International Bauerfield Airport of Port Vila and is part of a 30 million RMB grant from the Chinese Government (project #49212) following the destruction caused by Tropical Cyclone Pam, which hit Vanuatu on March 13th and 14th. According to "The Friendship of China and Vanuatu, Not Weakened but Consolidated by Cyclone Pam," this plane carried 260 tents for people who lost their homes.  This project is linked to project #49212, which is the 30 million RMB grant.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government grant for the first batch of Cyclone Pam emergency relief supplies (linked to project #49212)

# Description
On March 22nd, 2015, the first batch of emergency relief from the Chinese Ministry of Commerce arrived. It arrived by chartered plane at the International Bauerfield Airport of Port Vila and is part of a 30 million RMB grant from the Chinese Government (project #49212) following the destruction caused by Tropical Cyclone Pam, which hit Vanuatu on March 13th and 14th. According to "The Friendship of China and Vanuatu, Not Weakened but Consolidated by Cyclone Pam," this plane carried 260 tents for people who lost their homes.  This project is linked to project #49212, which is the 30 million RMB grant.
justification: Emergency relief supplies for disaster response, not directly related to energy or environmental impact
evidence: Emergency relief supplies including tents for disaster victims, humanitarian aid focus

title: Chinese Government grant for the second batch of Cyclone Pam emergency relief supplies (linked to #49212)
description: The second batch of relief supplies donated by China arrived on March 27th, 2015 at the Bauerfield International Airport of Port Vila (or 第二架援瓦紧急救灾包机). The donation comes in response to the Tropical Cyclone Pam, which hit Vanuatu on March 13th and 14th, and is part of a larger promise from the Chinese government to provide 30 million RMB of emergency relief supplies. The planes carried a total of 540 sets of tents, 65 pieces of tarpaulin, and 6.5 tons of cookies ("The Second Chinese Chartered Plane with disaster-relief goods arrived in Port Vila").  This project is linked to #49212, which is the 30 million RMB grant.
combined_text:

# Description
The second batch of relief supplies donated by China arrived on March 27th, 2015 at the Bauerfield International Airport of Port Vila (or 第二架援瓦紧急救灾包机). The donation comes in response to the Tropical Cyclone Pam, which hit Vanuatu on March 13th and 14th, and is part of a larger promise from the Chinese government to provide 30 million RMB of emergency relief supplies. The planes carried a total of 540 sets of tents, 65 pieces of tarpaulin, and 6.5 tons of cookies ("The Second Chinese Chartered Plane with disaster-relief goods arrived in Port Vila").  This project is linked to #49212, which is the 30 million RMB grant.

title: Chinese Government grant for the third batch of Cyclone Pam emergency relief supplies (linked to #49212)
description: On March 30th, 2015, the third batch of Chinese relief aid arrived at the Bauerfield International Airport of Port Vila (or 第三架援瓦紧急救灾包机). This aid comes as a part of the larger promise from the Chinese government to provide 30 million RMB of emergency relief aid after Vanuatu was hit by Tropical Cyclone Pam on March 13th and 14th. This plane brought 125 pieces of tarpaulin, 27 tons of vermicelli (dry/instant noodles) and 6 sets of 40 KVA diesel generators ("The Third Chinese Chartered Plane with Disaster-relief Goods Arrived in Port Vila").  This project is linked to #49212, which is the 30 million RMB grant.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government grant for the third batch of Cyclone Pam emergency relief supplies (linked to #49212)

# Description
On March 30th, 2015, the third batch of Chinese relief aid arrived at the Bauerfield International Airport of Port Vila (or 第三架援瓦紧急救灾包机). This aid comes as a part of the larger promise from the Chinese government to provide 30 million RMB of emergency relief aid after Vanuatu was hit by Tropical Cyclone Pam on March 13th and 14th. This plane brought 125 pieces of tarpaulin, 27 tons of vermicelli (dry/instant noodles) and 6 sets of 40 KVA diesel generators ("The Third Chinese Chartered Plane with Disaster-relief Goods Arrived in Port Vila").  This project is linked to #49212, which is the 30 million RMB grant.

title: Chinese Government grant in 2015 for the fourth and fifth batches of emergency relief supplies (linked to project #49212)
description: On April 2nd, 2015, the fourth and fifth planes carrying Chinese-granted relief aid landed at the International Bauerfield Airport of Port Vila (or 两架援瓦救灾物资包机). This donation comes in response to the Tropical Cyclone Pam, which hit Vanuatu on March 13th and 14th, and is the final part of a larger promise from the Chinese government to provide 30 million RMB of emergency relief supplies. According to "Two Chinese Chartered Planes with Relief Aid Arrived in Port Vila in One Day," these planes delivered, "35 tons of rice, 8 tons of vermicelli(dry noodle), 200 sets of 6 kva diesel generators, 10 pieces of tarpaulins, 14 sets of 40 kva diesel generators."    This project is linked to #49212 which is the 30 million RMB loan.
combined_text:

# Title
Chinese Government grant in 2015 for the fourth and fifth batches of emergency relief supplies (linked to project #49212)

# Description
On April 2nd, 2015, the fourth and fifth planes carrying Chinese-granted relief aid landed at the International Bauerfield Airport of Port Vila (or 两架援瓦救灾物资包机). This donation comes in response to the Tropical Cyclone Pam, which hit Vanuatu on March 13th and 14th, and is the final part of a larger promise from the Chinese government to provide 30 million RMB of emergency relief supplies. According to "Two Chinese Chartered Planes with Relief Aid Arrived in Port Vila in One Day," these planes delivered, "35 tons of rice, 8 tons of vermicelli(dry noodle), 200 sets of 6 kva diesel generators, 10 pieces of tarpaulins, 14 sets of 40 kva diesel generators."    This project is linked to #49212 which is the 30 million RMB loan.

title: Chinese Government provides Vanuatu Public Administration Officials Seminar
description: On October 14, 2015, Chinese Ambassador to Vanuatu Xie Bohuawa saw off students to the 2015 Vanuatu Public Administration Officials Seminar in Beijing. Mr. Erva, the head of the training department of the Vanuatu Civil Service Bureau, led the training, and 20 trainees participated. It was taught in French.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government provides Vanuatu Public Administration Officials Seminar

# Description
On October 14, 2015, Chinese Ambassador to Vanuatu Xie Bohuawa saw off students to the 2015 Vanuatu Public Administration Officials Seminar in Beijing. Mr. Erva, the head of the training department of the Vanuatu Civil Service Bureau, led the training, and 20 trainees participated. It was taught in French.
justification: Project focuses on capacity building and training for public administration officials, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Public Administration Officials Seminar, capacity building focus, no energy or infrastructure components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides $10 billion loan for balance of payments support
description: According to a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, the Chinese Government provided a $10 billion loan to the Government of Venezuela for balance of payments support in March 2015. Under the terms of the agreement, the Government of Venezuela was authorized to repay the loan via deliveries of oil and fuel by PDVSA.   In September 2015, the Economist Intelligence Unit reported that ‘Venezuela's external accounts […] have come under growing pressure in recent months on the back of lower oil prices. The Banco Central de Venezuela (the Central Bank) has not published any balance-of-payments data in 2015, so an accurate assessment of the external position is difficult, but a significant fall in international reserves indicates that the current-account surplus has been sharply eroded (potentially even registering a deficit) and that net capital outflows have continued.’  Then, in May 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Venezuela reportedly agreed to new commercial conditions for their oil-for-loans program that improved the terms for the Government of Venezuela.
staff_comments: 1. The China-Latin America Finance Database, which is co-produced by the Inter-American Dialogue and Boston University’s Global Development Policy Center, does not capture this $10 billion loan.  2. The oil-for-loans program between the Chinese Government and the Government of Venezuela involves the provision of debt that is collateralized against PDVSA income from daily oil sales to China National United Oil Corporation (ChinaOil).  3. The funding agency (lender) is not disclosed by any of the underlying sources. However, given that China Development Bank is the principal supplier of oil-backed loans to Venezuela, it is most likely the funding agency. This issue merits further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
GENERAL BUDGET SUPPORT

# Title
Chinese Government provides $10 billion loan for balance of payments support

# Description
According to a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, the Chinese Government provided a $10 billion loan to the Government of Venezuela for balance of payments support in March 2015. Under the terms of the agreement, the Government of Venezuela was authorized to repay the loan via deliveries of oil and fuel by PDVSA.   In September 2015, the Economist Intelligence Unit reported that ‘Venezuela's external accounts […] have come under growing pressure in recent months on the back of lower oil prices. The Banco Central de Venezuela (the Central Bank) has not published any balance-of-payments data in 2015, so an accurate assessment of the external position is difficult, but a significant fall in international reserves indicates that the current-account surplus has been sharply eroded (potentially even registering a deficit) and that net capital outflows have continued.’  Then, in May 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Venezuela reportedly agreed to new commercial conditions for their oil-for-loans program that improved the terms for the Government of Venezuela.
justification: The project is a financial loan for balance of payments support, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Loan for balance of payments support, repayment via oil deliveries, no specific environmental or energy-related components
